An Introduction to HTML and CSS Workshop | Code Equality

An Introduction to HTML and CSS Workshop

An introductory hands-on course for those who want to learn how to build websites with HTML and CSS.

Jul 20, 2014 9am-1pm Wisma Jobstreet, Lorong Medan Tuanku 1, KL

What is this?

An introductory hands-on course for those who want to learn how to build websites with HTML and CSS.

HTML and CSS are the building blocks of every website.

HTML is used to describe the content of a site. For example, this very paragraph is described in HTML.

CSS is used to style websites. All of the color and fonts, like this sentence that you see on this site is described in CSS.

Together, they can be used to build functional and beautiful websites. If you’ve ever wondered how websites were made and how you can make your own, now is the time to learn!

When and where is this happening?

Date Jul 20, 2014 (Sunday)
Time 9am-1pm
Venue Wisma Jobstreet, Lorong Medan Tuanku 1, KL
Registration Fee RM 15

Please be on time. We suggest that you plan to arrive at least 15 minutes before the event starts as it may take you time to locate the venue. For security reasons, we will have to tag you into the building. As such, we cannot allow entry for latecomers.

Is this for me?

Yes! You do not need previous coding or design experience, just bring yourself, a laptop and enthusiasm to learn. This class is suitable for beginners and would be ideal for secondary school and pre-university students.

We do ask that participants be at least 13 years old of age to join this class.

If you are a parent and would like to sign up for a younger child, please get in touch with us to ensure that the pace of the class would be suitable for them.

How do I sign up?

Step 1

Fill in this Google Form to register: http://bit.ly/intro_html_css

Step 2

There is a RM15 registration fee. We will email you the bank details with an invitation email. Please allow 48 hours for the invitation.

Please send us (hello@CodeEquality.org) a screenshot of your bank transfer as we need to verify your transaction with our bank statement.

Step 3

Your seat is only confirmed once we have received the deposit and we will email you with the confirmation. Please note that your seat is not guaranteed until you have received the seat confirmation from us.

Note: If you have secured a seat (paid RM15 and received confirmation from us) but cannot attend, please let us know at before July 17, 11:59PM and we can refund you the registration fee. If you do not inform us before July 17, 11:59PM, your registration fee will be forfeited.

What will we be doing?

We will be building a static website from scratch! By the end of the class you will have the basics to further venture out in the world of web design and development. Here is an example of a simple homepage. Some of the topics we’ll be covering are the basics of HTML/CSS, website design and how to upload a website.

What would I need for this class?

For the class

You will need to bring your laptop, charger and an extension plug (if you can) for this class. Any type of laptop or operating system (Mac, Windows, Linux, etc) can be used for this class. Please make your own arrangements to borrow a laptop for this class if you do not own one.

Before the class

  • Install a browser. Chrome or Firefox are preferable.
  • Install a text editor. We recommend Sublime Text

Who’s teaching this class?

Our volunteer instructor for this class is Sher Minn Chong

Sher Minn is a freelance front-end web developer and designer. Having developed her interest in web design out of her passion for building things, she hopes to share this knowledge with others who would like to build their own web projects.

Some of the projects and companies she has worked with are Code Equality, Cafehop KL, Oracle and Jobstreet. She is also the co-founder of Code Equality.

How do I get there?

Public Transport

The venue is easily accessible via LRT or Monorail. The nearest stations are

  • Medan Tuanku Monorail station ( < 5 min walk)
  • Dang Wangi station on LRT Kelana Jaya line (10 min walk)
  • Sultan Ismail station on LRT Ampang Line (10 min walk via overhead bridge)

Who is Code Equality?

Code Equality is a non-profit with the purpose of educating Malaysian students about coding and Computer Science. We hold affordable coding classes, company visits and other events that are open for all.

To find out more about us, check out our About section .

I’d like to help out!

Sure! We’re always on the lookout for tutors to assist students during the class. All of our instructors and tutors are volunteers. Just drop us an email at hello@CodeEquality.org and we’ll get back to you!

I have more questions!

Feel free to contact us at hello@CodeEquality.org . Please give us 24 hours to respond to your enquires.
